intro: Gardenia archboldiana, commonly known as the Archbold gardenia, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Maui in Hawaii. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces fragrant, white flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, requiring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Due to its limited natural range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
